title: Sampler, 19th century
medium:
Medium: silk, linen, and beads on canvas
Technique: cross, stem, buttonhole, satin, long-armed cross, feather, chevron, and knots, embroidered on plain weave foundation; counted stitches
dimensions: Height 32 cm (12 5/8") x width (selv. to selv.) 73 cm (28 3/4")
creditline: Gift of Anonymous Donor from the Fraser/Martin Collection
description: Several different patterns and motifs including vase of carnations and grapes, sprays of flowers, cornucopia of flowers, curving vines, and geometric patterns in colored silks and white cotton. At the lower right is a pattern of birds and trees in embroidery with beads, each sewn on independently.

tombstone.epitaph:
Sampler, 19th century.
19th century. Medium: silk, linen, and beads on canvas
Technique: cross, stem, buttonhole, satin, long-armed cross, feather, chevron, and knots, embroidered on plain weave foundation; counted stitches. Gift of Anonymous Donor from the Fraser/Martin Collection. 1976-100-14.
